intro: Crotalaria colorata subsp. colorata, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves with three to five lobes, and it produces distinctive pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and is a common weed in agricultural areas. The species is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
